Joining data



Data tidying and importing

Data Science with R

Setup

Task, goal, and tools


have multiple data frames

want to join them together

using tools from the tidyverse

library(tidyverse)

Data: Women in science

Information on 10 women in science who changed the world:

name
Ada Lovelace
Marie Curie
Janaki Ammal
Chien-Shiung Wu
Katherine Johnson
Rosalind Franklin
Vera Rubin
Gladys West
Flossie Wong-Staal
Jennifer Doudna

Source: Discover Magazine

Joining data frames

Joining data frames

something_join(x, y)
  • left_join(): all rows from x
  • right_join(): all rows from y
  • full_join(): all rows from both x and y
  • semi_join(): all rows from x where there are matching values in y, keeping just columns from x
  • inner_join(): all rows from x where there are matching values in y, return all combination of multiple matches in the case of multiple matches
  • anti_join(): return all rows from x where there are not matching values in y, never duplicate rows of x
  • â€¦

Setup

For the next few slidesâ€¦

x <- tibble(
  id = c(1, 2, 3),
  value_x = c("x1", "x2", "x3")
  )

x
# A tibble: 3 Ã— 2
     id value_x
  <dbl> <chr>  
1     1 x1     
2     2 x2     
3     3 x3     
y <- tibble(
  id = c(1, 2, 4),
  value_y = c("y1", "y2", "y4")
  )

y
# A tibble: 3 Ã— 2
     id value_y
  <dbl> <chr>  
1     1 y1     
2     2 y2     
3     4 y4

left_join()

left_join(x, y)
Joining with `by = join_by(id)`
# A tibble: 3 Ã— 3
     id value_x value_y
  <dbl> <chr>   <chr>  
1     1 x1      y1     
2     2 x2      y2     
3     3 x3      <NA>

left_join()

professions |>
  left_join(dates)

Putting it altogether

professions |>
  left_join(dates) |>
  left_join(works)
Joining with `by = join_by(name)`
